intro: Nematolepis squamea subsp. squamea, commonly known as the squamose nematolepis, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, scale-like hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional Māori medicine for their purported healing properties. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is commonly found in forest understoreys.
